page.title: 04HARPERS BROOK (SUDBOROUGH)
page.content:
Harpers brook is a small brook. It is shallow in most places but can be up to five feet deep. It has much vegetation on its steep banks. The water is clear with a large population of fish which include
pike, brown trout, rainbow trout, roach, gudgeon, dace minnows, bullheads, perch, zander, and chubb.
These are fished by local fisherman. The brook also has a wide range of wildfowl living on it such as ducks, moorhens and coots. Also mink and stoats have been seen. Farther down stream are man_made banks a weir and a research station. This stream often floods after long rain storms.
